text: hi everyone new thingy face tano here
the internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review of this new
imperial trampon record spirit of
ecstasy this is a brand new lp from new
york avant-garde metal outfit imperial
triumphant the third time i'm covering
the band's music on this channel i
believe and each time they have
consistently blown me away with their
dense unforgiving and dissonant brand of
extreme metal that brings in elements of
technical death metal black metal and
even jazz and i was pretty curious as to
how the band would up the ante on spirit
of ecstasy here in a way i suppose they
did because with this one they managed
to release their most claustrophobic and
punishing record yet the band's
trademark use of hideous riffs pummeling
drums grand arrangements cinematic
effects and gruesome vocals all make it
onto spirit of ecstasy right from the
jump but it seems like this time around
imperial triumphant has deprived the
listener of any space or atmosphere to
digest what is going on in real time
take the opener chump change for example
whose opening riffs are so sour that
they reek like a pile of rotting corpses
but from here we have a building wall of
busy drum fills intense bass lines
distorted metallic clangs and vile
guttural scream vocals plus these dower
horn sections rising up in the
background it all makes for a pretty
frightening display and also perfectly
fits the song's lyrics about new york
city being a capitalist dystopia where
everything is for sale with towering
altars of gluttony in every direction
now as if the sound of all of this
wasn't already smothering somehow the
riffs get even heavier after this
eventually morphing into some super
psychedelic solo passages the whole
track is quite the ride the dizzying and
overwhelming vibes continue onto metro
vertigo the pacing and the grooves on
this one i found to be not as visceral
or exciting the whole thing gets pretty
tiresome pretty fast i think the whole
first leg especially this cut is a bust
outside of these falling grand piano
notes at one point the whole first half
of this track is more stagnant than
nearly anything else on this lp those
constantly ascending and descending
dissonant riffs can really only do so
much especially when the drums behind
them feel like they are on autopilot and
the vocals on top are doing i don't know
some kind of like a spaced out death
metal rant the progressions on tower of
glory city of shame are a lot more
gripping i love the dramatic and
wondrous string sections harp as well as
spoken word vocals that open the intro
sounds like something out of an old
hollywood horror film then what busts in
are these very chaotic and rubbery
guitar riffs in 3 4 which simultaneously
sound twisted and zany the whole song
feels like the soundtrack to slowly
going insane as i joined this
technocratic cult with all of these very
odd group chants and mantras set to this
gruesome orchestra of death metal
instrumentation it's a lot to take in in
the best way possible from here we get
more weepy strings on mercurius gilded
where instrumentally we actually get
some of the grandest layers on the
entire record i just wish they were
given the room to breathe in the mix
that they had on alphaville back in 2020
especially with those insane sac solos
harmonizing with the guitars in the
second half i think the boomy and
compacted presentation of this
instrumentation
really only darkens the luster of what
imperial champion is doing a problem
that only becomes more apparent as the
band instrumentally gets more ambitious
like on the towering string sections and
hammered dulcimer melodies on the
following track which again are very
pretty but quite buried in the mayhem
surrounding them with the guitars and
drums and vocals this is the kind of
densely mixed madness you would
typically expect from a portal record
which is not entirely a bad thing but i
don't know if it's the best move or
direction for this to have gone in now
keeping with this lp's themes of new
york urban apocalypse we have in the
pleasure of their company which is this
whole instrumental cut of a very grim
metropolitan jazz fusion with a lot of
walking bass trumpet electric guitar
keys these cats are cooking and they're
doing it with a very
strange and unsettling death metal
atmosphere there are truly some great
and fantastic improv passages on this
track and the whole thing progresses
into a heavier more metal driven sound
in the second half major highlight on
the lp no doubt meanwhile the track
benzumnaya is this maddening metal
theater piece with a lot of extreme
distorted screams some spoken word
passages in russian yeah the whole track
seems to be in russian and i guess the
song is about this guy
and his struggle
to make it up a mountain and
symbolically this could be about like
you know life's various struggles and
obstacles hitting you and i think he
like dies on this journey and becomes a
part of the mountain the interpretation
could be lost on me as russian is not my
strong suit but i do have to give it to
imperial triumphant for delivering such
a unique turn on this album even if i
think the whole first half of the track
is a little long-winded respect for
delivering the most hellish passage of
music in the second half though the
gross capitalistic aspirations of this
lp reach into the stratosphere with the
closing cut maximalist scream which
seems to be about a mid-century space
race of some sort that may make the
russian tie-in of the previous track
make more sense the sentiment of this
cut is very much about advancement at
the sacrifice of pretty much everything
else i also love the open spacious
prague metal sections in the second half
the vocal switch up during this portion
of the track too i mean this is the kind
of space and clarity that i was hoping
to hear throughout the midpoint of this
record as well but alas i didn't really
get it still though i think this is a
pretty harrowing and interesting album
from imperial triumphant for the most
part great performances song ideas and
concepts super super super unique
compositions winding song structures
edge of your seat progressions crazy
instrumental palettes for metal record
as well as genre fusions the band
continues to be one of the best and most
creative forces in new york metal today
yes i do have some mixing issues on some
of the tracks here and for the most part
i thought the second one was really a
dud but outside of that a lot of
fantastic things going for this album
and uh certainly a metal record i think
you should hear this year especially if
your tastes run kind of left field i'm
feeling a light too decent seven on this
one tran position have you given this
album a listen did you love it did you
hate it what would you rate it you're
the best you're the best what should i
review next hit the like if you like
please subscribe and please don't cry
hit the bell as well over here next to
my head is another video that you can
check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel anthony fantano
imperial triumphant
of forever
